relation: Student organizations serving a wide range of interests
Religious groups active on campus, including InterVarsity Christian Fellowship and Lutheran Student Movement, Catholic Campus Ministry and the Hillel Student Organization
Hours spent on community service by students each year
Cross-cultural groups on campus, including Asian Cultural Association, Black Student Union, Gender & Sexuality Alliance and Hispanic Organization for Latino Awareness (HOLA)
Dedicated student social spaces – Charlie's Coffeehouse and TRAX, regularly hosting student-planned entertainment and activities
pageTitle: Susquehanna University - Admissions: Experience By the Numbers
textBeforeTable: Student Life By the Numbers Home › Admissions & Financial Aid › The Total Experience › By the Numbers   TitleAbout - 0 3674 Skip to Content Skip to Navigation pageLevelMid">
textAfterTable: The Campus Number Fact 325 Scenic acres featuring Georgian architecture spanning nearly 150 years > 60 Facilities, including performance and recital halls, an art gallery, fitness center and student nightclub 90% Students residing on campus in 11 residence halls and 15 college-owned residential homes 2 Buildings on the National Register of Historic Places 1,500 Seats in Weber Chapel Auditorium, Susquehanna's largest indoor venue for lectures and performances Athletics and Recreation Number Fact 23 NCAA Division III intercollegiate sports; member of the Centennial Conference (football and women’s golf), the Empire 8 (men’s golf) and Landmark Conference 3 Racquetball courts in the Garrett Fitness Complex, which also houses a swimming pool, fitness center, basketball courts, indoor track and snack bar 26 Acres of playing fields for baseball, field hockey, lacrosse, rugby, soccer and softball < 1 Mile from campus to the Susquehanna River, the university's namesake 8 Intramural sports and activities offered, ranging from 5-on-5 basketball and flag football to indoor soccer and volleyball Navigation
